200.description: Service request is OK and a response has been generated.

400.description: There appears to be a syntax error in the composition of the service request. The response structure may contain information about the error. If the base URI or service request URI is invalid, any response will come as an HTTP response.

403.description: The user does not have access to the resource.

404.description: The target resource can not be found for the provided resource identifiers.

405.description: The service method is not supported by the service.

409.description: A conflict has occurred. The response structure may contain information about the conflict.

500.description: An error occurred generating the response to the service request. This is strictly a server error and not an application error.

200.description: Service request is OK and a response has been generated.

PUT: Tunnel through a GET with attributes in the query string name value pairs
Tunnel through a POST with attributes in POST content name values pairs

netid.description: Online account or network identifier of an individual

surname.description: Often the family name of the individual or last name

surname_first.description: A boolean indicator.  If true (any non null value) indicates that the surname is read first instead of last.  A null value or false will indicate that the surname is to be read last.  If omitted no change will be made to the surname position setting.

use_preferred_on_id_card.description: A boolean indicator.  If true (any non null value) indicates that the preferred first name is to be printed on the ID card of the individual.  A null value or false will indicate that the given names, defined by the rest_of_name attribute, are to be printed on the ID card of the individual.  If omitted no change will be made to the ID card name setting.

suffix.description: Name suffix such as Jr, Sr, II, etc...
suffix.conditions: Must be a defined value in the provided suffix table set

resource.note: If an attribute is not present in the PUT request, the current value in the database will be retained.  That is to say only the values that need changed need be present in the PUT request.  Examples: /[personid]?surname=Young, /[personid/preferred_first_name=Brigham, /[personid]?surname=Young&rest_of_name=Brigham&preferred_first_name=Brigham&surname_first=true

warnings: Non-Directory information is accessible only to yourself and to university personnel with a legitimate need to know
